meanings.definition: Relating to or involving measurement by weight.
meanings.sent1: The gravimetric analysis of the soil samples provided accurate weight measurements.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a gravimetric scale to measure the mass of the object.
meanings.sent3: The gravimetric scale at the carnival was so sensitive, it could even weigh a feather.
meanings.sent4: Her gravimetric approach to dieting involved carefully monitoring the food she consumed.
meanings.sent5: The gravimetric method of measuring ingredients ensures precise amounts for baking.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the measurement of gravity.
meanings.sent1: The gravimetric data collected by the researchers helped them understand the gravitational pull in the area.
meanings.sent2: The gravimetric survey revealed variations in gravity across the region.
meanings.sent3: The gravimetric experiment on the moon showed different results due to its lower gravity.
meanings.sent4: His gravimetric calculations accounted for the gravitational force acting on the object.
meanings.sent5: The gravimetric study focused on the gravitational interactions between celestial bodies.

meanings.definition: Determined by or involving the measurement of weight.
meanings.sent1: The gravimetric properties of the material influenced its weight-based characteristics.
meanings.sent2: The gravimetric analysis indicated a correlation between weight and volume.
meanings.sent3: The gravimetric measurements were crucial in determining the weight distribution of the cargo.
meanings.sent4: Her gravimetric calculations were based on the weight measurements of each component.
meanings.sent5: The gravimetric method provided a reliable way to measure weight accurately.
